help.what_is_en: This scenario allows you to summarize your data by grouping it at two or more levels. For example, it is useful for viewing total sales by city and product. This way, you can analyze your data better and base your decisions on more solid foundations.
how_to_en: 1. First, upload the Excel file containing your data.
2. In the group columns field, enter the names of the columns by which you want to group your data. You must enter at least two columns.
3. In the value column field, enter the name of the column that contains the numerical data you want to summarize.
4. From the aggregation function field, select how you want to summarize your data.
5. Optionally, you can add a date filter. Fill in the date column, start date, and end date.
6. Finally, initiate the process and download the Excel file containing your summary information.
Tip: Adding more columns as group columns allows you to analyze your data in more detail.
Caution: Make sure to enter date fields in the correct format.
examples_en: Example Scenario: You have a sales data file and you want to see total sales by city and product. With this scenario, you can select city and product columns as group columns and set sales amount as the value column to get the totals.
